headline: Pumpkin Waffles with Apple Cider Syrup
description: These waffles contain two of our favorite seasonal flavors: pumpkin and apple cider.
name: Pumpkin Waffles with Apple Cider Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.

Combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, allspice, ginger, salt, and brown sugar in a mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, stir together the pumpkin, milk, and egg yolks. Whip the egg whites in a clean dry bowl until soft peaks form.

Stir the flour mixture and 1/4 cup melted butter to the pumpkin mixture, stirring just to combine. Use a whisk or rubber spatula to fold 1/3 of the egg whites into the batter, stirring gently until incorporated. Fold in the remaining egg whites. Cook waffles according to manufacturer's instructions.

To make the syrup, stir together the sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon in a saucepan. Stir in the apple cider and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until mixture begins to boil; boil until the syrup thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the 2 tablespoons of butter until melted. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: This is the second time I have made this recipe. I must have liked it enough last year to remember it this year. Some of the complaints are weird, so I will sum up my experience: You're making waffles from scratch. Yes, it is going to be a little messy. It is not worse than normal. If you're having trouble cooking, something might be wrong with your waffle maker. My little, ancient thrift-store pickup managed it twice now. They do look like a mess at first - if you open the waffle maker too soon. If you close it and let it cook longer, the batter should solidify. I find that the waffles don't have a strong pumpkin flavor, but that's okay. They are still good. The cider syrup is delicious. This time, I didn't have eggs on hand, so I used applesauce instead. It worked perfectly. I also used a wheat flour, since I was out of AP. On top of that, I added some pumpkin spice to the batter.
Super bland and didn't cook. Put in my waffle maker on max for 17 mins. Was raw inside and barely cooked on the outside. I had to turn into pancakes instead so the outside would crisp

These were amazing. I made them exactly by the recipe. Avoid dense waffles by mixing the egg whites as per the directions. We topped them with whipped cream and they were fantastic. Great pumpkin recipe!

These were ok. I made the recipe with no changes. They cooked well for me and I had no issues cooking them. The flavor was blander than I thought it would be. Couldn't taste the pumpkin that much. The syrup was pretty good. Tasted like apple cider. I don't think I would make them again though based on the numerous steps involved.

Absolutely excellent waffles ( I didn't make the syrup, but would like to try it next time). I just substituted maple syrup for the brown sugar and added a couple teaspoons of natural maple extract. These did not turn out dense at all; they were crisp on the outside, light inside and wonderfully flavorful. Overmixing might be what caused some people to have dense waffles. Mix the flour into the wet ingredients just until combined. There may be some lumps, and that's OK. Also, don't overmix the beaten egg whites; it's OK to have a few white lumps. Letting the waffles sit in a 200 degree oven for a few minutes after baking them helps crisp up the outside. I will definitely add this recipe to my favorites!
A lot of extra work for only modest reward. They were as good as a regular waffle and took three times as long to make.
I made waffles for my family and everybody like it very much. We had some pumpkin jam with waffles.
Traded gluten free flour for the all purpose and added 1/4 tsp xanthim gum and 1 tsp baking soda. Came out great!
I lessened the sugar amounts to 1/3 c for the syrup Taste great

Made these for dinner tonight because I happened to have some leftover pumpkin. Prepared exactly as written without modifications and they were AMAZING. The syrup was perfect and not too sweet. Saving to my favorites as we will be having these again!
Good topped with whipped cream. Daughter likes it with pecans added to the waffle iron

I only made the syrup and it is outstanding! I’ll be making this for gifts for Christmas, it’s so good. I was concerned that so much sugar would be too sweet and make it so sweet that you couldn’t taste the apple, but it didn’t. The lemon juice adds a depth of flavor that is perfect.

I used up a baked sweet potato for the 1 cup pumpkin and 1 cup buttermilk and 1 cup regular milk. I used my immersion blender to mix the sweet potato, milk, and egg yolks. Waffles got cooked until a darker brown and they were crisp on the outside and moist and soft on the inside.

I thought this was delicious. I substituted pumpkin pie spice for the other spices. It had a great balance of flavor. The syrup was the perfect match.
Yummy!!
Delicious! Family loved these- especially with the homemade syrup. Yum!
This recipe is absolutely delicious! I made the syrup and also homemade whipped cream and roasted pecan pieces. Wow! I actually can't wait to make it again.
love it! Simple to make and so yummy. We love love the apple cider syrup as well!
I have made this recipe many times over the years. The key to this recipe is to beat the egg white. It’s time consuming but oh, so worth it! My family asks for it the first day of fall
Fall fav!

I used a waffle mix instead of flour and baking powder. I also sprinkled sprouted pumpkin seeds onto the batter once on the waffle iron. This made toasted pumpkin seed in the waffles which I though was delicious!
Delicious and makes a lot! Great for breakfast/brunch when family visits. The cider syrup was absolutely fantastic. I might punch up the spices in the waffles a little bit next time.

These are delicious! However, I read the instructions and said out loud, “Yeah, that’s not happening.” I beat the egg whites a bit with a whisk but not til they had soft peaks. I also didn’t bother mixing everything so carefully (1/3 of this and 1/4 of that) just mixed wet and dry ingredients separately. They turned out great and were the perfect consistency. I was carefully not to over mix the dry and wet ingredients. I also didn’t make the syrup. I was just too hungry!
I love this! This is brilliant thank you, I love waffles and needed a change, this is now a new go to.

The waffles didn't really have the pumpkin flavor so using pumpkin just made the waffle more dense. Next time, I would just make a regular cinnamon waffle with this recipe and add pumpkin to the syrup instead. The corn starch amount in the syrup could be halved.
Omg ! Omg !! Delicious !!! Absolutely delicious!!!
I will definitely make it agian

Very tasty and really great texture.
Absolutely one of our favorite waffle recipes!
I didn’t make any changes to the recipe I only added sautéed apples with pecans sautéed in butter and whipped cream. Guests couldn’t stop raving! Will make again!
Waffles came out flavorful. I substituted the allspice for pumpkin pie spice and they were delicious.
Delious even better with whipped cream and sprinkled with pumpkin pie spice
I’m making them ahead of time for tomorrow’s breakfast. The Apple Cider Syrup taste amazing. I can’t wait to dig into them in the morning.
Everyone loved it

Great changeup for morning waffles! For time savings, be assured there is no need to separate the eggs and beat/fold in the egg whites. I actually forgot to separate the eggs and feared the waffles would be too dense, but I just whisked the wet ingredients well, and the waffles were just fine! I think next time I'll increase the spices a bit, but otherwise the recipe is great!
I doubled the recipe. It was perfect. We make it every year as our first fall dish
Very nice, I didn't make the sauce to go over it. I just used whipping cream and a dollop of syrup.

Flavors were good, not overly strong like everything labeled "pumpkin spice" these days. We didn't do the cider syrup.... Next time for sure will try that. Maple syrup with some cinnamon over mascarpone cheese made for a delicious topping. I may mix a little corn starch into the batter next time for more crispness, as I do in my basic waffle recipe.

A great recipe to usher in Fall. The recipe is dense, so a little goes a long way. The syrup is delicious and the use of cider & lemon juice make it a nice contrast to the waffles. One critical omission is having whipped cream to top them.

I just made this today for breakfast and it was GREAT! Now I did follow one review and added a tad more pumpkin (maybe a couple spoonfuls more than the 1 cup it called for). Also I used another tip and used 1 tablespoon of pumpkin pie spice and 1 tablespoon cinnamon instead of the ginger and allspice combo. YUM! Yes the batter is a bit thicker than normal waffle batter I make, but I cooked longer and they turned out perfect. Also to the reviewer who said this is a 'messy' recipe; I make waffles from scratch all the time and this is no messier than normal. Maybe I'm just a slob! I will say the waffles are not sweet per say, but the dynamite syrup makes up for that. I did not change a thing when I made the syrup. Follow it as is (including the butter at the end) and you will not be disappointed!
Made both recipes as they were written, plus did a dairy free version....all turned out perfect! So great for the first cool morning of the year! They do take longer to cook then normal waffles.
Amazingly good with apple cider syrup!
The syrup is great, but I felt the spices in the waffles mixed with syrup was too much

Doubled batter, quadrupled syrup. Have been lusting after this since it first arrived by email! That leftover thanksgiving cider was just taking up room as it’s original form. What a transformation most definitely a keeper! Never folded egg whites into waffles but I’m thinking it added to their crispyness, no oil, butter or margarine in batter mixture!
Great taste, but too much work.

The waffles did not come out dense like some reviews said, but I found I did need to add a little more milk to make the correct consistency. The waffles were pretty good, however, the syrup was fantastic and was what made this recipe wonderful.
The wife loves this, and is fantastic with a bit of whipped cream on top. I did find that I had to cook these a bit more in the waffle iron than normal waffles, but that's just a small adjustment.
No..this was a complete mess in waffle iron.

made without any changes and the waffles were great nice and fluffy batter... the syrup was way way too sweet even for the kids but the flavor was nice next time I will make some changes on the syrup... or just use regular syrup
I really enjoyed the texture of these waffles and the Apple Cider syrup was a nice touch; however, I was looking for more pumpkin taste.
Followed the recipe, but I adjusted the spices just a bit (didn't have them all so used pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon), waffles turned out light, fluffy and very flavorful. Great recipe!
great
So good!! We will definitely make these again!!
It was great.
Great recipe, a little time consuming, but everyone loved it
I followed the recipe as written and the waffles were delicious! I did have to double the syrup recipe though. I will definitely make them again.

I halved the recipe, since I only had a half cup of pumpkin. I also used 3/4c almond flour, 1/2c white flour to lower the carbs and increase the fiber. They were delicious! I will definitely make this again!
For the first time making it was very good next time I would like to try it with apple sauce that is unsweetened just to cut out the sugar

I followed the recipe. I mixed the dry ingredients and made the apple cider syrup the night before to speed things up in the morning. They were fantastic, everyone loved them. There were six of us and I had enough leftover waffles to freeze. Hopefully, they will freeze well as waffles usually do. I doubled the recipe for the apple cider syrup and glad that I did, it was delicious and can be used on pancakes or maybe even on a plain sponge cake. I will definitely make this recipe over and over again. Some of the other reviewers complained of dense waffles - mine came out very light and fluffy, they were actually moister than waffles usually are.

So admittedly I did not make the syrup as we did not have any apple cider in the house. So maybe that makes all the difference. But these "pumpkin" waffles did not taste like pumpkin waffles to me. They were good. But my family and I could not taste the pumpkin nor could we taste any of the spices. We are big pumpkin fans so that was a total let down. If I were to make these again, I would definitely up the pumpkin and spices. But I will probably just search for a different recipe instead as I'm not quite sure how increasing the pumpkin puree would impact the fluffiness of the waffles themselves.
Amazingly delicious!
Very good! I used apple juice because I can't get apple cider where I live but it was delicious!
You all did good on your waffle nice job people
Delicious waffles! I followed the recipe exactly, except added pecans. I also used regular syrup. Excellent recipe!! Thank you for sharing it!

I made this for two different retreats this fall. The syrup is perfect in taste and consistency! I also had leftovers that I took home to give to family members and the waffles , that I had frozen, heated up nicely in the oven still wrapped in the tin foil. I didn't put in the ginger bc I thought it would be too much spice going on so I did add a little more cinnamon. I made mine in a Belgium waffle makers, not sure if that makes a difference for others. The pancakes were light in texture and taste but the flavor really came out when adding the syrup. A very special part of our brunch. Will do this again and again!

Ok, the apple cider syrup is worth 5 stars alone!!! It’s like liquid apple pie!!! Would be amazing on SO many things!

That being said, the waffles were good, but as many other reviewers stated, they were fairly dense, even when folding in the whipped egg whites. It must’ve been the pumpkin purée. I also couldn’t taste any pumpkin, but it may have just needed a little more of the spices. Like I said, they were good, but it was syrup that definitely made them!

I made this for Christmas day breakfast. The directions of mixing the dry with the wet seemed a bit confusing - not well written. The egg whites were whipped to stiff peaks instead of soft. They were good but I felt the waffles tasted in even better after frozen and warmed in the toaster! I saved some time and measured the dry ingredients the day before. 

The apple cider syrup was perfect -- added a great flavor to the waffles. Then a dalop of whip cream on top! yum

Yum!! These are great breakfast waffles! I made a few healthy changes. I put half a cup of oatmeal to fill in the flour, but I still put half a cup of flour! You also can put a cup banana to fill in for the pumpkin completely! You only have to make one change to make it banana muffins. Also, you can only use half a cup of banana and half a cup of pumpkin to make a mix waffle.
Most peoples recipes for waffles are way too thick, need more water.
Only made the syrup to serve over whole grain waffles (made with a mix). Very easy to make and delicious!

Followed the recipe exactly. Whipped the egg whites and all. They turned out great! Very fluffy waffles. We even used a Belgium waffle maker which normally produces deep crisp waffles, this recipe turned out fluffy and light. This recipe has good flavor but doesn't over power. Unfortunately, we didn't have anything on hand to make the apple cider syrup with. To replace that though I made a cream cheese type filling but cut back on the sugar. Amazing.

Fantastic recipe!!! I made no changes and encourage others to do the same. I was appreciative of Allrecipes adjustment for number of servings, saving me from doing my own morning math. The waffles and syrup are just delicious. "Best waffles I ever had!" Said my wonderful, appreciative man. Just make them and enjoy!
I thought the waffles were ok. The syrup was terrific! I would make it again and put it over regular waffles.
This actually made a nicer pancake than waffle, we thought. Waffles took so long I dumped some mix on a griddle! I didn't try the syrup, but hope to sometime.
I did add extra cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg. Other than that I made it as written. We topped it with whipped cream (of course) and thought they were fantastic!

These are amazing! This is one of those take a bite, put down your fork and savor the moment recipes. I followed the recipe exactly but did make a couple of rookie mistakes following simple instructions, as per my usual. In spite of my efforts to ruin this recipe, it came out fantastic. The waffles are light and tasty. Not too much pumpkin, not too little. The syrup is delightful. Creamy and not too sweet. My only thing that is wrong with this recipe is that for my tastes, it doesn't make enough syrup. I feel like the syrup portion of this recipe needs to be doubled. Thank you for a GREAT recipe.
love love love this! thanks for sharing. the apple cider syrup combined with the waffle is amazing!

Great recipe. Wonderful flavors. The syrup is perfect with the pumpkin waffles. The only substitution I made was to add slightly more cinnamon to the recipe and replace the lemon in the sauce with orange and orange zest. The orange flavor is a perfect fall compliment. My only complaint is that the waffles never got crispy and cooking time did not make a difference to change this fact. I cooked these for 4-5 minutes. We'll make these again!
Added extra pumpkin. otherwise kept everything the same. best waffles I've ever made.
Loved the syrup!! A delicious, unique and seasonal topping for pumpkin waffles/pancakes.

I have made this twice now, but used the "Buttermilk Syrup" recipe instead of the provided recipe for syrup. Also, I had no ground ginger so I added a pinch of mace. After mixing together the dry ingredients, I mixed in all the wet ingredients with the dry ingredients instead of mixing them separately, and also made it more simple by using 4 eggs and not separating the eggs and the yolks. Very good recipe!! But I don't see the purpose behind separating everything and creating more work. It is truly a great recipe without the additional steps!
I haven't tried the syrup but made the waffles today and they were perfect. I didn't add allspice and I only used a little ginger so that my kids would eat them. They turned out great
No changes made except for some low fat ingredient substitutes. VERY good, I impressed my husband and two guests. Definitely a keeper.
Very good just wish they were a little crispier
This review is only for the syrup. The syrup is absolutely delicious!!!! Perfect for the first weekend of fall! I didn't and wouldn't change a thing! I"ll update my review when I make the waffles.
Well, the batter stuck to the top of the waffle maker despite several attempts to modify and prevent it from doing so. The taste was a good solid meh...

This was a really great recipe. I'm not too into the separate the eggs type, and I unfortunately had a yolk crack into my egg white bowl, so I never got fluffy peaks to fold in. That being said, I still got a nice waffle out of it. Not dense, but hearty. I liked it a lot. As for the spices, I have a HUGE container of pumpkin pie spice in my cupboard, so I omitted the spices (ginger/allspice/cinnamon) for slightly the same total measure of pumpkin pie spice. It came to 1 1/3 tablespoons, I just used 1 1/2 tablespoons for the same servings and it turned out great. I also just double the whole recipe and used 1 can of pumpkin since I saw no point in wasting it. The waffles turn out great, but the spice still almost felt underwhelming UNTIL I added the cider syrup. Changed the whole dish. The whole family chowed down like nobody's business, my toddler went back for thirds, and I still had some to freeze for quick weekday breakfasts by doubling the recipe. Definitely in Sunday morning rotation

I used 4 teaspoons of Pumpkin Spice instead of all of the individual spices. I did add 1/4 cup of sugar because I was afraid they were going to be bland like some other reviews claimed. I don't know if it made that big of a difference.

I love this recipe!! It is very good. I accidentally changed it the first time I made it by adding a whole can of pumpkin puree, almost double what the recipe called for. After trying it the way it is written I liked my accidental changes better. It makes it more flavorful. I also like to make waffle batter the night before so I skip the part about whipping the egg whites and folding them in afterwards. It makes the prep time a lot faster and the waffle still turn out nice.
These waffles are the best waffles I have ever eaten . Mmmm ,Mmmmm ,Mmmmm the syrup is also delicious to the max!!!

My family loves these waffles so much that they have become a regular for weekend breakfasts all year. I adjust the spices to our taste but otherwise make them as the recipe states. They are a hearty waffle that will fill you up, not light or insubstantial, and that's one reason I like them. I haven't tried the Apple Cider Syrup yet because I like the Maple Syrup that is made/sold in my area. They are also delicious with cream cheese or homemade cream cheese frosting on top! Thanks for the recipe!!
Made the waffle (not syrup) and it was great!
Followed the instructions as written. The whole family liked them.

I LOVED these waffles! I did take the advice of others and add more sugar, but everything else was done as is and came out PHENOMENALLY!! Fluffy, savory - ALL OF THE ABOVE! I made so many, I froze some and have breakfast for the week. Thanks again for a dynamic recipe!!

Doubled the batch and made these for Sunday brunch yesterday. Few modifications after reading the other reviews. Since others mentioned a bland taste, I tripled the seasoning and sugar which gave it a nice but subtle flavor. Some said the syrup recipe was not enough for the waffle recipe so I tripled the measurements and had more than enough. Waffles were good alone but really good with the apple cider syrup. They were dense and did need to cook longer in the waffle iron - some almost got burned but it's all good. This is definitely a recipe I will make again.
I turned the batter I to pancakes, and I didn't quite get the syrup made right. Overall, this is a very good recipe. Next time I will get the syrup made correctly!
Fabulous!
We used fresh pumpkin for this and it was wonderful! I think it is the sauce that really makes it though. The syrup was incredible!!

These were absolutely delicious! I did use bisquick instead of flour also added a lot more cinnamon and a 1/2 cup of brown sugar I didn't make the syrup instead I drizzled light agave and topped it with some crushed walnuts mixed with cinnamon and sugar

This review is only for the waffle. My kids did enjoy it but... I was not comfortable eating it because it was a little too gooey on the inside for my liking. I cooked them longer that I should and they were still gooey.

Used 2 cups of white and wheat flour and 1 1/2 cups of buttermilk, 1 less egg and added 1 tsp of pumpkin pie spice. It was crispy (although it cooked longer than normal) and not too heavy. I folded in the eggs and let the batter sit. I also used white chocolate chips in the batter so I didn't need any syrup. I added vanilla to the syrup after removing it from the heat. The syrup tasted good but would have been better with the waffles. The syrup was to thick so I'll use less corn starch next time.

item.name: Pumpkin Waffles with Apple Cider Syrup
